Pre-Game Insights: A new-look Indian T20 team would embark on a journey of self-discovery without their constant talismans, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
Shubman Gill, who was a reserve in the T20 World Cup squad, will lead the team along with a bunch of IPL performers.
Two young men, Abhishek Sharma and Riyan Parag, are lined up for their international debut.
Zimbabwe, led by Sikandar Raza, could prove to be a handful on nippy afternoons at the Harare Sports Club.
Shivam Dube, Sanju Samson, and Yashasvi Jaiswal will be available from the third match onwards.
The national team will play 34 games in the shortest format from now till the 2026 T20 World Cup in India.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match starts at 4:30 pm IST.
